page.title: 10The Parish Council
page.content: The Parish Council covers the whole of the area within the Parish boundaries. Sutton and Carlton have seperate Parish Councils. In Sutton there are 1089 voting members of the public. The Chairman, Vice Chairman, Parish Clerk(not an elected member of the council),and individual councilors have responsibility for representing the council on school governors,youth club,playing fields, cemetry upkeep, twining etc. The Council is elected by a poll of all members of the electoral role. It makes recommendations to the District Council on matters such as planning, footpaths, housing needs and it passes on village views on County matters. Parish Council meetings are open to the public.
